Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Sometime last year, I became really interested in what REST and the ideas
of Hypermedia actually are. Since then, I've done a lot of
reading/searching/fumbling/etc.

First, I'd like to thank those that have taken time to explain ideas in
mailing lists/books/etc.

Second, I'd like to ask those wiling to let me know how well my
understanding is. I fully believe that the best way to prove if someone
understands something is to have them explain it to you. I decided to try
this out by answering a question on StackOverflow that I felt was something
I probably would have asked back when I was first starting out.

I know it's pretty long, but if anyone would like to take the time to check
out the question (
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9727394/whats-the-best-most-restful-way-to-simulate-a-procedure-call-over-http)
and my resulting answer (
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9727394/whats-the-best-most-restful-way-to-simulate-a-procedure-call-over-http#answer-11919274)
and let me know of anything you would disagree with to help me in my
understanding.

Thanks

-- 
Mark Hildreth

--90e6ba6e8c52a3a99604c708922c
